_header: All too late all too late / when the wain is at the gate
_description: A proverb, translating Tardam crede moram cum plaustrum stat prope portam — one couplet

BodDou52.Transcription: Alle to late alle to lateWhen deth is come to ȝate
BodDou52.Editions:
Förster,  Max. 
             “Die Mittelenglische Sprichwörtersammlung in Douce 52.” 
             Festschrift zum XII Deutschen Neuphilolgentage in München
                1906.
            E. Stollreither, ed. 
         Erlangen (1906): 40-64: 52.

CULGg11.Transcription: Al to late al to lateWan þe deth is at þe yate
CULGg11.Note:
Follows 2800 as a rubric
                    colophon quod marcol.

RylandsLat394.Transcription:
alle to late all to lateWhen þe weyne is at þe
                    ȝate
RylandsLat394.Note: Written all on a single line of MS; Latin text follows.
RylandsLat394.Editions:
Pantin,  William A. 
             “A Medieval Collection of Latin and English Proverbs…from Rylands
                Latin MS. 394.” 
             Bulletin of the John Rylands Library
         14 (1930): 81-114: 102.
